data.title: Three Capitals of Lithuania Trakai Kernave Vilnius
meta_keywords: fun things to do in vilnius
data.meta_description: Enjoy this tour and take the opportunity to see three towns vital for the history of Lithuania. You will explore Kernave with its Unesco-protected hill-forts; Trakai with its wonderful Island castle; and Vilnius an its Unesco-protected old town. You can customize this tour and include optional sites for free - Peter and Paul church in Vilnius, Uzupis district. You can also enjoy a Boat trip in Trakai (for additional charge). Lunch at traditional restaurant and entrance fees are not included in the price.
data.text:
The tour, and especially the tour guide, Giedrius Cyras, who was so knowledgeable, friendly, realistic. I insisted I have him as my guide on my tour the next day, and he was even better than today. The capitals are all beautiful, and having the chance to see places like this one-on-one with...

The tour, and especially the tour guide, Giedrius Cyras, who was so knowledgeable, friendly, realistic. I insisted I have him as my guide on my tour the next day, and he was even better than today. The capitals are all beautiful, and having the chance to see places like this one-on-one with a local person made it all the more interesting and better. He helped me understand my Lithuanian heritage, and the country as it was, and now is.

This was a great tour. Being able to see the three places gave me different perspectives on Lithuania. The guide was incredible and knowledgeable about each location. The lunch was delicious and authentic.

This was a great tour. Being able to see the three places gave me different perspectives on Lithuania. The guide was incredible and knowledgeable about each location. The lunch was delicious and authentic.

Great, sweeping tour of history with a LOT packed into a single (enjoyable) day! My guide, Giedirus, was a smart, personable companion (he’s also a university teacher, which is always good) who took me off the beaten paths to see the city, the beautiful countryside, and the fairy tale Castle at T...

Great, sweeping tour of history with a LOT packed into a single (enjoyable) day! My guide, Giedirus, was a smart, personable companion (he’s also a university teacher, which is always good) who took me off the beaten paths to see the city, the beautiful countryside, and the fairy tale Castle at Trakai. Kernave was a especially interesting addition to this tour because it sets up a missing part of the story that most people don’t see about how Lithuania became a culture during its pagan origins. Great tour!

Wow. What a tour. I learned so much about the history of Lithuania and about Lithuania today. Trakai is a must see, and Karnave is quite lovely -- that alone made the trip worthwhile. But what made the trip amazing was all of the information and the contextualization. This was a great trip, and I...

Wow. What a tour. I learned so much about the history of Lithuania and about Lithuania today. Trakai is a must see, and Karnave is quite lovely -- that alone made the trip worthwhile. But what made the trip amazing was all of the information and the contextualization. This was a great trip, and I highly recommend it.
